meanings.definition: To make or become Greek in character or style.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys grecianizing her home decor with blue and white colors.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant started grecianizing its menu by adding Mediterranean dishes.
meanings.sent3: The school play grecianized the classic tale of Romeo and Juliet.
meanings.sent4: Her love for Greek mythology grecianized her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush grecianized the plain canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of imitating or adopting Greek customs or traditions.
meanings.sent1: The grecianizing of their wedding ceremony included olive branches and laurel wreaths.
meanings.sent2: She studied the grecianizing of ancient Greek architecture for her thesis.
meanings.sent3: The grecianizing of the festival brought togas and Greek dances to the town.
meanings.sent4: His grecianizing of his wardrobe with sandals and tunics was quite a sight.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased the grecianizing of pottery and sculptures from ancient Greece.
